citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
An active IACUC approved protocol involving 65 cattle, of which 12 of the cattle are to undergo a yet to be performed liver
biopsy procedure, did not include a written narrative description of the methods and sources used for considering
alternatives to this procedure. Submission of protocols lacking this information does not allow a comprehensive IACUC
review of proposed activities, ensure that alternatives that might minimize pain and distress have been adequately
considered by the principal investigator, and that procedures involving animals will avoid or minimize discomfort, distress,
and pain to the animals. Revise the above protocol and resubmit for IACUC review prior to performing the liver biopsy
procedure and ensure that all protocols presented to the IACUC for review, where more than momentary or slight pain
and distress to animals occurs, include a written narrative of the materials and sources used for considering alternatives
to these procedures. The facility immediately initiated corrective measures at the time of inspection. Correct by: 22
November 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Facility Representatives.
End of report.
n

narrative:
2.31(d)(1)(ii) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
An active IACUC approved protocol involving 65 cattle, of which 12 of the cattle are to undergo a yet to be performed liver 
biopsy procedure, did not include a written narrative description of the methods and sources used for considering 
alternatives to this procedure. Submission of protocols lacking this information does not allow a comprehensive IACUC 
review of proposed activities, ensure that alternatives that might minimize pain and distress have been adequately 
considered by the principal investigator, and that procedures involving animals will avoid or minimize discomfort, distress, 
and pain to the animals. Revise the above protocol and resubmit for IACUC review prior to performing the liver biopsy 
procedure and ensure that all protocols presented to the IACUC for review, where more than momentary or slight pain 
and distress to animals occurs, include a written narrative of the materials and sources used for considering alternatives 
to these procedures. The facility immediately initiated corrective measures at the time of inspection. Correct by: 22 
November 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Facility Representatives. 
 
End of report.
